CatDescriptText: Mr. Richard Cobbs, 113 Erin Street, and Mr. James Bigelow, 91 Sylvania Avenue, Beltzhoover, were part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 9, 1957, pg. 2, with question: "Do you believe that licensed taverns are as harmful to a neighborhood as speakeasies and gambling joints? Why?"  Mr. Richard Cobbs' answer reads: "No, I don't.  Speakeasies and gambling joints are not wanted in a neighborhood where there are churches.  The noises from licensed places are heard during the week, but are closed down on Sunday and things are quiet.  But the speakeasies and gambling joints have the noise going on week in, and week out."  Mr. James Bigelow's answer reads: "Some taverns are bad, but speakeasies and gambling joints are worse.  They just ruin the youngsters."
TitMainTitle: Richard Cobbs and James Bigelow wearing plaid shirts, standing in front of block street and ribbed metal wall
